message.content:
<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: public void deleteStudent(int studentID){
    Iterator<Student> iter = students.iterator();
    while (iter.hasNext()){
        Student ob = iter.next();
        if (ob.getStudentID() == studentID){
            iter.remove();
            break;
        }
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: The error you're getting is a ConcurrentModificationException, which occurs when you try to modify a collection while iterating over it. To fix this, you need to create a new iterator inside the deleteStudent method before starting the loop.
